title: Trump says Jeff Bezos 'solved the problem' after White House attacks Amazon on tariff price labeling plan
Taiwan's government strengthens 'silicon shield,' restricts exports of TSMC's most advanced process technologies
Canada will deal with Trump 'on our terms', Carney tells BBC
description: Speaking exclusively to the BBC, Canada's PM says he will only visit the US when there is a "serious discussion to be had".

title: Life inside Iraq's 'Forbidden Zone' controlled by Turkey
description: Turkey has been building military bases on Iraqi territory, the BBC finds, raising fears of an occupation.

title: Markets digest bank earnings after recent turmoil
Still haven't filed your taxes? Here's what you need to know
description: So far this tax season, the IRS has received more than 90 million income tax returns for 2022.

title: Samsung's first-quarter operating profit and revenue beat expectations on smartphone, chip sales
description: The South Korean company posted a record quarterly revenue, up 10% from a year earlier, while its first-quarter operating profit climbed 1.5%.

title: Trump: 'I think we'll have a deal with India' on tariffs and trade
description: Trump's comments come after Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said the U.S. was "very close on India."

title: At BRICS Summit, Brazil Warns Against Protectionism Amid Trump Tariff War
description: Foreign ministers from the BRICS group of developing nations failed to reach a joint communique on Tuesday after meeting in Rio de Janeiro, but chair Brazil issued a statement speaking out against trade protectionism.

title: 3 Killed, Several Injured In Shooting In Swedish City: Cops
description: Three people were killed in a shooting in the Swedish city of Uppsala on Tuesday and a murder investigation has been launched, police said.

title: Canada Election Takeaways: What’s Next for Mark Carney and the Liberals
description: The former central banker successfully convinced voters that he was the right candidate to confront President Trump’s trade war and threats to annex the country.
author: Matina Stevis-Gridneff and Ian Austen

title: A Mother and Father Were Deported Under Trump. But What Happened to Their Daughter?
description: The Trump administration sent the mother of a 2-year-old to Venezuela and the father to a Salvadoran prison. Their daughter remains somewhere in the United States.
author: Julie Turkewitz and Isayen Herrera

title: Trump marks his first 100 days in office with a rally in Michigan, a state rocked by his tariffs - AP News
description: Trump marks his first 100 days in office with a rally in Michigan, a state rocked by his tariffs  AP NewsTrump holds campaign-style Michigan rally in to mark 100 days in office  NBC NewsAn Unsustainable Presidency  The AtlanticLawsuits, executive actions, confirmations and golf trips: Key moments in Trump’s first 100 days  CNNTrump Touts ‘Greatness’ in Michigan Rally as Voters’ Economic Concerns Mount  WSJ

title: Harvard’s President Says ‘I’m Sorry’ After Scathing Bias Reports - Bloomberg
description: Harvard’s President Says ‘I’m Sorry’ After Scathing Bias Reports  BloombergHarvard Promises Changes After Reports on Antisemitism and Islamophobia  The New York TimesTwo Harvard task forces release reports on campus antisemitism and anti-Muslim bias  CNNLong-awaited Harvard antisemitism report shows intense campus hostility to Jews, Israelis  The Times of IsraelAs Trump clamps down, Harvard finds evidence of antisemitism, Islamophobia on campus  USA Today

title: Canada’s new leader faces big challenges related to Trump and beyond
description: With Donald Trump, western alienation and a spiraling cost-of-living crisis, Canada’s new prime minister has his hands full.
author: Amanda Coletta

title: Cause of Spain power outage still unclear after mass blackout, travel chaos
description: Red Eléctrica, Spain’s electricity grid operator, ruled out a cyberattack, human error or unusual weather. Experts say it could take weeks to determine the cause.
author: Adrián Blanco Ramos, Anumita Kaur, Chico Harlan

title: Fears for health of Alaa Abd el-Fattah and mother as hunger strikes take toll
description: Activist jailed in Egypt receives medical treatment and family worry his mother Laila Soueif is ‘dying in slow motion’The family of the imprisoned British-Egyptian activist Alaa Abd el-Fattah say they fear for his health along with that of his mother, Laila Soueif, as both continued their hunger strikes to demand his freedom.Relatives of Soueif said they were worried she was “dying in slow motion” after eight months on full or partial hunger strike. “What are we supposed to do, just sit around and wait to die?” said Soueif. Continue reading...
author: Ruth Michaelson

title: Trump’s first 100 days supercharged a global ‘freefall of rights’, says Amnesty
description: World now in era of repressive regimes’ impunity, climate inaction and unchecked corporate power, says reportThe first 100 days of Donald Trump’s presidency have “supercharged” a global rollback of human rights, pushing the world towards an authoritarian era defined by impunity and unchecked corporate power, Amnesty International warns today.In its annual report on the state of human rights in 150 countries, the organisation said the immediate ramifications of Trump’s second term had been the undermining of decades of progress and the emboldening of authoritarian leaders. Continue reading...
author: Mark Townsend

title: Canada's anti-Trump vote hands Liberals dramatic win
Donald Trump doubled down on China tariffs, says 'they deserve it'
description: US President Donald Trump defended his trade policies, asserting China would likely bear the tariff costs. In an ABC News interview, Trump dismissed concerns about price increases, stating China was "ripping us off." He doubled down on China tariffs, saying 'They deserve it.
author: TOI World Desk
